no.uio.duo

Class DuoState

  • java.lang.Object
    • no.uio.duo.DuoState

  • public class DuoState
extends java.lang.Object
    Convenience class for representing the event state of an item in DSpace

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      DuoState(Item item)
      Construct a DuoState object around the given item.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      java.lang.String getEmbargo()
      Get the raw embargo metadata for the item
      java.lang.String getGrade()
      Get the current grade for the item
      java.lang.String getRestrictions()
      Get the current restrictions on the item
      java.lang.String getState()
      Get the current state of the item (workflow, withdrawn, archived)
      boolean hasChanged()
      Compare the current item metadata with the duo.state properties and determine if this item has changed.
      boolean isInstalled()
      Is the item installed in Duo?
      void recordStateOnItem()
      Record the current internal representation of the item's state onto the item in duo.state
      void setInstalled(boolean installed)
      Set the item's installed status.
      void sychroniseItemState(boolean itemUpdate)
      Synchronise the current item metadata state to the duo.state field
      void updateState(java.lang.String state, java.lang.String grade, java.lang.String embargo, java.lang.String restrictions)
      Update this object's internal representation of the item's state.

      • DuoState

        public DuoState(Item item)
         throws DuoException
        Construct a DuoState object around the given item. This extracts all the metadata from the item which backs the interface to this object
        Parameters:
        item -
        Throws:
        DuoException

        public boolean hasChanged()
        Compare the current item metadata with the duo.state properties and determine if this item has changed. For example, the item's metadata may have been updated by another process
